Package CCDD

Class CcddInputTypeHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • CCDD.CcddInputTypeHandler
  • public class CcddInputTypeHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    CFS Command and Data Dictionary input type handler class

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      protected class  CcddInputTypeHandler.InputTypeReference
      Variable (command) reference class; used to contain information on structure (command) tables of the same table type having a column with the variable (command) reference input type
      protected class  CcddInputTypeHandler.ReferenceCheckResults
      Input type reference check results class

      • isInputTypeValid

        protected boolean isInputTypeValid​(java.lang.String inputTypeName)
        Check if the an input type exists with the specified name
        Parameters:
        inputTypeName - input type name to match (case insensitive)
        Returns:
        true if an input exists with the specified name

      • isInputTypeChanged

                                     CcddClassesDataTable.InputType inputTypeB)
        Check if the two input types differ
        Parameters:
        inputTypeA - first input type to compare
        inputTypeB - second input type to compare
        Returns:
        true if the input types differ

        Returns:
        Array containing the custom input type definitions

        protected void setInputTypeData​(java.lang.String[][] customInputTypes)
        Set the input types by combining the default types with those in the supplied array
        Parameters:
        customInputTypes - array containing the custom input type definitions

      • updateVariableReferences

        protected void updateVariableReferences()
        Update the variable references input type selection item list. Based on whether or not the variable list is empty, add or remove the input type from the list of those having selection items

      • updateCommandReferences

        protected void updateCommandReferences()
        Update the command references input type selection item list

      • updateMessageReferences

        protected void updateMessageReferences​(java.awt.Component parent)
        Update the message references input type selection item list with the supplied message name, ID, and owner list. Based on whether or not the message list is empty, add or remove the input type from the list of those having selection items
        Parameters:
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog

      • getInputTypeByName

        protected CcddClassesDataTable.InputType getInputTypeByName​(java.lang.String inputTypeName)
        Get the input type with the name that matches the one specified
        Parameters:
        inputTypeName - input type name to match (case insensitive)
        Returns:
        Input type with the name that matches the one specified; returns the input type for text if the input type doesn't exist

      • getInputTypeByDefaultType

        protected CcddClassesDataTable.InputType getInputTypeByDefaultType​(CcddConstants.DefaultInputType defaultInputType)
        Get the input type with the name that matches that of the specified default input type
        Parameters:
        defaultInputType - default input type to match (DefaultInputType)
        Returns:
        Input type with the name that matches the one specified; returns the input type for text if the input type doesn't exist

      • getSelectionInputTypes

        protected java.util.List<CcddClassesDataTable.InputType> getSelectionInputTypes()
        Get the list of input types that have an item array
        Returns:
        List of input types that have an item array

      • convertItemsToRegEx

        protected static java.lang.String convertItemsToRegEx​(java.lang.String itemString)
        Convert the supplied input selection item string to the corresponding input match regular expression
        Parameters:
        itemString - string containing the acceptable values for this input type, separated by the selection item list separator; null or blank if the input type doesn't constrain the inputs to items from a list
        Returns:
        Regular expression that matches only the items in the selection list

      • getInputTypeNames

        protected java.lang.String[] getInputTypeNames()
        Get an array of all of the input type names, excluding separators and breaks
        Returns:
        Array of all of the input type names

      • getNames

        protected java.lang.String[] getNames​(boolean customOnly)
        Get an array of the input type names (all or user-defined only), excluding separators and breaks
        Parameters:
        customOnly - true to only include user-defined input types; false to include all input types
        Returns:
        Array of all or only user-defined input type names, sorted alphabetically; an empty list if no user-defined input types are defined and only user-defined types are requested

      • getDescriptions

        protected java.lang.String[] getDescriptions()
        Get an array of all of the input type descriptions, sorted based on the alphabetically sorted input names, excluding separators and breaks
        Returns:
        Array of all of the input type descriptions

      • formatInput

        protected static java.lang.String formatInput​(java.lang.String valueS,
                                              CcddConstants.InputTypeFormat inputFormat,
                                              boolean preserveZeroes)
        Reformat the input value for numeric types. This adds a leading zero to floating point values if the first character is a decimal, and removes '+' signs and unneeded leading zeroes from integer and floating point values
        Parameters:
        valueS - value, represented as a string, to reformat
        inputFormat - input type format (InputTypeFormat)
        preserveZeroes - true to preserve leading zeroes in hexadecimal values; false to eliminate the extra zeroes (this is useful when comparing the text representation of two hexadecimal values)
        Returns:
        Input value reformatted based on its input type

      • searchInputTypeReferences

        protected java.lang.String[] searchInputTypeReferences​(java.lang.String inputTypeName,
                                                       java.awt.Component parent)
        Get the references in the table type and data field internal tables that match the specified input type name. Only the columns containing input types in the table type and data field internal tables are searched
        Parameters:
        inputTypeName - input type name for which to search
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        List containing the tables in the database that reference the specified input type name; an empty array if no matches are found

      • updateInputTypes

        protected void updateInputTypes​(java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> inputTypeDefinitions)
                         throws CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException
        Add new input types and check for matches with existing ones
        Parameters:
        inputTypeDefinitions - list of input type definitions
        Throws:
        CcddClassesDataTable.CCDDException - If an input type with the same same already exists and the imported type doesn't match

      • getInputTypeReferences

        protected CcddInputTypeHandler.ReferenceCheckResults getInputTypeReferences​(CcddConstants.DefaultInputType inputType,
                                                                            java.awt.Component parent)
        Get the results of a search for references in the table type and data field internal tables for the specified default input type
        Parameters:
        inputType - default input type for which to search (DefaultInputType)
        parent - GUI component over which to center any error dialog
        Returns:
        Reference to the ReferenceCheckResults containing the list of references in the table type and data field internal tables that use the specified input type (an empty list if there are no references) and the flag that indicates if a data field is using the input type
